{"id":1503507526,"question_id":3425,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"4Â weeks","timestamp":1736467457,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"77 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1503507526/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Maximum Number of Potholes That Can Be Fixed","memory":"46.2 MB","code":"class Solution {\npublic:\n    int maxPotholes(string road, int budget) {\n        //repair n consecutive potholes for a price of n + 1.\n        int ret = 0;\n        priority_queue<int, vector<int>> holes; //max\n        int i=0;\n        while(i<road.length()) {\n            if(road[i]=='.')\n                i++;\n            else {\n                int j = i;\n                while(j<road.length() && road[j]=='x')\n                    j++;\n                holes.push(j-i);\n                i=j;\n            }\n        }\n        while(!holes.empty() && budget > 0) {\n            int cur = holes.top();\n            holes.pop();\n            if(cur+1 <= budget) {\n                ret += cur;\n                budget -= (cur+1);\n            } else {\n                cur = cur - budget -1;\n                ret += budget -1;\n                break;\n            }\n            i++;\n        };\n\n        return ret;\n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"maximum-number-of-potholes-that-can-be-fixed","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
